goals: Provide a list of recipes based on the specified cuisine.
Ensure that all recipes are appropriate for the given dietary restrictions.
Offer recipes with specific nutritional values, such as calorie count or protein content.
Suggest recipes that use ingredients commonly found in the region or country associated with the cuisine.
Recommend recipes that can be prepared within a certain time frame (e.g., 30 minutes or less).
Allow users to filter recipes by dietary preferences (e.g., vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free).
Provide detailed information about each recipe, including cooking time, ingredients, and step-by-step instructions.
Display ratings and reviews from other users who have tried the recipe.
Enable users to save their favorite recipes for future reference.
Offer suggestions for variations or modifications to the original recipe.
Identify key ingredients based on the recipe provided.
Provide a list of alternative ingredients for each key ingredient.
Suggest substitutions that maintain the flavor profile of the dish.
Consider dietary restrictions and allergies when making suggestions.
Ensure all suggested ingredients are readily available in most grocery stores.
Allow users to filter suggestions by price range.
Display nutritional information for each ingredient.
Offer a brief description of each ingredient, including its origin and uses.
Allow users to save their favorite ingredient suggestions for future use.
Generate a comprehensive list of ingredients suitable for the given recipe.
Provide clear instructions on how to prepare the dish using the suggested ingredients.
Allow users to customize the level of detail in the ingredient suggestions.
Integrate with online grocery shopping services to provide easy access to recommended ingredients.
Enable users to compare prices across different stores for recommended ingredients.
Suggest recipes that use similar ingredients as the provided recipe.
Provide an option to exclude specific ingredients from the suggestions.
Allow users to adjust the number of servings in the recipe to see how it affects ingredient quantities.
Provide a feature to allow users to rate or review ingredient suggestions to improve future recommendations.
Suggest local and seasonal ingredients to promote sustainability and reduce food waste.
Allow users to create and save personalized ingredient lists for quick access.
Suggest ways to adapt the recipe based on availability of ingredients.
Provide information about the origin and quality of recommended ingredients.
Allow users to specify dietary preferences such as gluten-free, vegan, or low-fat to tailor ingredient suggestions.
Suggest alternative cooking methods or techniques based on ingredient availability.
Provide guidance on storage and shelf life of suggested ingredients.
Suggest complementary ingredients that enhance the flavor of the recipe.
Allow users to search for specific types of ingredients such as herbs, spices, or proteins.
Suggest variations of the recipe using different ingredients for variety.
Provide tips on how to use suggested ingredients in other dishes.
Suggest ingredient substitutes based on cost and availability.
Provide step-by-step instructions for cooking a specific dish.
Offer tips on how to prepare ingredients, such as cleaning and cutting.
Suggest alternative ingredients if some are not available.
Recommend tools and equipment needed for the task.
List possible variations of the recipe.
Share tips on food safety and hygiene.
Explain the importance of following the instructions carefully.
Provide information about the nutritional value of the dish.
Offer ideas for serving and garnishing the finished product.
Encourage users to share their own cooking tips and experiences.
Provide a clear and concise explanation of the chosen cooking technique.
List the necessary equipment and ingredients for each step of the technique.
Describe the steps involved in performing the technique in a logical order.
Explain the rationale behind each step, including why it is important to follow that particular step.
Offer tips and tricks for mastering the technique, such as common mistakes to avoid or ways to improve the results.
Provide examples of dishes that can be prepared using the technique.
Include visual aids, such as photos or videos, to help users understand the technique better.
Allow users to ask questions or provide feedback on the explanation.
Ensure that the explanations are accurate and up-to-date with current culinary practices.
Make sure the explanations are accessible to users of all skill levels, from beginners to advanced cooks.
Display a clear comparison of the ingredients required for each recipe.
Provide a side-by-side comparison of preparation time for both recipes.
Compare the number of servings for each recipe and display the information clearly.
Allow users to select which aspects of the recipes they want to compare (e.g., calories, cost).
Calculate and display the total cost of ingredients for each recipe based on user input or default values.
Highlight any similarities or differences between the two recipes in terms of ingredient availability.
Offer a summary of the key differences between the recipes, including preparation time, ingredients, and serving size.
Allow users to save their comparisons for future reference.
Generate a report that compares the nutritional value of each recipe, including calories, fat, protein, carbohydrates, etc.
Enable users to customize the format of the comparison report (e.g., table, graph).
Provide an option to sort the recipes by specific criteria (e.g., most affordable, quickest to prepare).
Allow users to filter the results based on dietary restrictions or preferences (e.g., gluten-free, vegetarian).
Display the estimated time required to prepare each recipe step-by-step.
Offer suggestions for substitutions if certain ingredients are not available.
Provide a feature to allow users to rate and review recipes after comparing them.
Allow users to search for recipes based on specific keywords or ingredients.
Display a list of similar recipes for each compared recipe.
Offer an interactive visualization of the recipe comparison, such as a heat map or bar chart.
Allow users to export the comparison results in various formats (e.g., PDF, CSV).
Provide real-time updates on the availability of ingredients based on user location.
Offer personalized recommendations based on previous recipe comparisons and user preferences.
Integrate with other food-related services, such as grocery shopping lists or meal planning tools.
Allow users to share their recipe comparisons with others through social media or email.
Provide detailed instructions on how to make each recipe after the comparison is complete.
Offer a «favorites» feature where users can save their favorite recipe comparisons.
Provide a «history» feature that allows users to view their previous recipe comparisons.
Allow users to set up notifications when new recipes are added that match their interests.
Provide a search function that allows users to find specific recipes based on their preferences.
Offer a feature that allows users to create custom recipe comparisons based on their own criteria.
Allow users to access their recipe comparisons from any device or platform.
Allow users to create shopping lists based on recipes.
Provide a user-friendly interface for entering recipe information.
Automatically generate a shopping list based on the recipe ingredients.
Allow users to customize their shopping lists by adding or removing items.
Enable users to save and share their shopping lists with others.
Allow users to view their shopping lists in a variety of formats, such as text, spreadsheet, or image.
Provide suggestions for substitutions when an ingredient is unavailable.
Offer a search function to help users find recipes quickly.
Allow users to add notes to their shopping lists.
Provide statistics about the items on the shopping list, such as total cost and quantity.
Ensure that the shopping list is accurate and up-to-date.
Allow users to print their shopping lists for easy reference.
Integrate with other applications, such as grocery store loyalty programs.
Offer personalized recommendations based on past shopping history.
Allow users to set budgets for their shopping lists.
Provide real-time updates on prices and availability of items.
Allow users to schedule their shopping trips based on their schedules.
Offer tips and tricks for saving money while shopping.
Provide a secure platform for storing and sharing shopping lists.
Allow users to access their shopping lists from any device.
Offer support for multiple languages.
Allow users to choose between metric and imperial units.
Provide an option to export shopping lists to other applications.
Allow users to import shopping lists from other applications.
Offer a free version with limited features and a paid version with additional features.
Allow users to rate and review recipes.
Offer a feature to allow users to share their favorite recipes with others.
Allow users to filter recipes by dietary restrictions.
Offer a feature to allow users to track their progress on completing their shopping lists.
Allow users to receive notifications when it's time to buy items on their shopping list.
Accurately calculate the calorie content of a meal based on its ingredients.
Provide users with a clear understanding of the nutritional value of their meals.
Allow users to make informed decisions about their diet and health.
Support users in achieving their dietary goals, such as weight loss or weight gain.
Encourage healthy eating habits by providing accurate information about calorie intake.
Enable users to compare the calorie content of different meals to choose the most appropriate option.
Facilitate meal planning by helping users estimate the total calorie intake for a day or week.
Promote a better understanding of nutrition and its impact on health.
Assist users in monitoring their calorie intake over time to track progress towards their goals.
Offer a user-friendly interface that is easy to use and understand.
Allow users to convert between different units of measurement.
Provide accurate conversions based on user input.
Support a wide range of unit types and conversions.
Ensure that conversions are performed correctly and consistently.
Display the result of the conversion in a clear and concise manner.
Allow users to choose their preferred output format (e.g., decimal, fraction, or scientific notation).
Provide a user-friendly interface for entering unit and quantity values.

Handle edge cases such as zero or negative quantities gracefully.
Allow users to save frequently used conversions for future use.

Offer a history of previous conversions for easy reference.
Provide clear instructions and examples for using the command.
Allow users to customize the appearance and behavior of the command (e.g., theme, language, etc.).
Integrate with other tools and systems for seamless data exchange.
Support internationalization and localization for different regions and languages.
Offer detailed documentation and support resources for users.
Implement error handling and logging mechanisms for troubleshooting.
Conduct regular testing and maintenance to ensure reliability and performance.
Consider security implications and implement appropriate measures to protect user data.
Allow for customization of unit names and symbols for specific applications.
Support both manual and automated conversions for different workflows.
Offer an API for developers to integrate the command into their own projects.
Provide feedback and suggestions for improving the command based on user feedback.
Maintain compatibility with older versions of the software for backward compatibility.
Offer a versioning system for tracking changes and updates to the command over time.
Allow users to export and import their custom conversions for sharing and collaboration.
Provide an option to automatically update conversions based on external sources.
Offer a sandbox mode for testing new conversions without affecting live data.
Implement a learning algorithm to suggest conversions based on historical usage patterns.

command: Plan a menu: "plan_menu", args: "days": "<number of days>", "people": "<number of people>"
goals: Determine the number of people attending the event.
Calculate the total number of meals based on the number of days and people.
Choose a suitable type of menu (breakfast, lunch, dinner, etc.) based on the time of day.
Select appropriate dishes based on dietary preferences, seasonality, and budget.
Estimate the cost of each dish and calculate the total cost of the menu.
Consider the availability of ingredients and adjust the menu accordingly.
Create a balanced menu with a variety of dishes to cater to different tastes.
Ensure that the menu is nutritionally balanced and meets dietary requirements.
Plan the timing of meals to fit the schedule of attendees.
Provide options for vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free diets if applicable.
Allow for customization of the menu based on individual preferences.
Include drinks in the menu, such as coffee, tea, water, juice, alcohol, etc.
Specify the serving size for each dish.
List the required equipment and utensils for preparing the dishes.
Assign tasks to specific chefs or cooks based on their skills.
Allocate enough time for preparation and cooking.
Consider any special occasions or events that may influence the menu choices.
Provide an estimated time frame for serving each meal.
Evaluate the feasibility of the planned menu in terms of cost, time, and resources.
Make adjustments to the menu if necessary based on feedback from stakeholders.
Communicate the finalized menu to all relevant parties.
Keep track of the ingredients used and the amount spent on each item.
Maintain a record of the number of servings prepared and served.
Assess the success of the menu by collecting feedback from attendees.
Identify areas for improvement in future menus based on this feedback.
Share the menu with attendees in advance to allow them to make dietary requests or changes.
Adjust the menu according to any dietary restrictions or allergies mentioned by attendees.
Consider cultural or religious preferences when planning the menu.
Ensure the menu reflects the theme or occasion of the event.
Review the menu after the event to identify areas for further improvement.

command: Book a table at a restaurant: "book_table", args: "restaurant": "<restaurant>", "date": "<date>", "time": "<time>"
goals: Allow users to select a restaurant from a list of available restaurants.
Provide users with the option to choose a date and time for their reservation.
Confirm the availability of the selected table at the chosen date and time.
Reserve the table for the user at the specified date and time, if it is available.
Notify the user if the selected date or time is not available at the requested restaurant.
Store the reservation information in a database for future reference.
Allow users to cancel or modify their reservations as needed.
Send confirmation emails to both the restaurant and the customer after the reservation is made.
Ensure that the reservation data is secure and protected against unauthorized access.
Display the status of each reservation (confirmed, canceled, etc.) to the user.

Allow users to search for restaurants based on specific criteria such as cuisine type, location, or price range.
Provide real-time updates on the status of the reservation, including any changes in availability.
Integrate with other services such as payment processing or loyalty programs.
Enable users to view their past reservations and manage them accordingly.
Allow restaurants to manage their own reservation system through an admin interface.
Implement a notification system to alert users when their reservation is approaching.
Offer a mobile app version of the booking system for easy access on the go.
Provide a seamless experience across all devices and platforms.
Allow for integration with third-party services like Google Maps or Yelp for better recommendations.
Implement fraud detection measures to prevent fraudulent bookings.

Allow customers to rate their experiences with the restaurant after their visit.

Offer discounts or special offers for frequent customers.
Allow restaurants to customize their booking process according to their needs.
Implement a feedback system for customers to provide suggestions for improvement.
Offer an API for developers to integrate the booking system into their applications.

Provide a menu with detailed descriptions and prices for each item.
Enable users to place an order by selecting items from the menu.

Notify the restaurant of the order.

Ensure that the order is delivered on time.
Allow customers to rate and review their takeout experience.
Offer discounts or promotions based on past orders.
Integrate with delivery services to ensure efficient and timely delivery.
Allow restaurants to manage their menus, pricing, and availability.
Provide analytics to restaurants on popular items, average order size, and customer preferences.
Implement a secure payment system to protect customer data.
Allow restaurants to customize their online presence, including their menu and branding.
Offer a seamless and convenient ordering experience for customers.
Integrate with social media platforms to allow customers to share their takeout experiences.
Provide real-time updates on order status and estimated delivery times.
Offer multiple payment options, such as credit card, debit card, and cash on delivery.
Allow customers to schedule their orders in advance.
Provide personalized recommendations based on previous orders and preferences.
Offer loyalty programs and rewards for frequent customers.
Allow restaurants to offer special discounts and promotions through the platform.
Provide an easy-to-use interface for both customers and restaurants.
Offer customer service support to resolve any issues during the ordering process.
Collect feedback from customers to improve the quality of service.
Regularly update the platform with new features and improvements based on customer feedback.

command: Set up a virtual cooking class: "set_up_class", args: "class_name": "<class name>", "participants": "<participants>", "duration": "<duration>"
goals: Create a virtual cooking class with a specific name.
Invite participants to the class.
Set the duration of the class.
Provide all necessary materials and equipment for the class.
Assign a teacher for the class.
Send notifications to participants about the upcoming class.
Allow participants to ask questions about the class before it starts.
Ensure that the class is accessible to all participants.
Collect feedback from participants after the class ends.
Evaluate the success of the virtual class based on participant feedback.
Improve future classes based on feedback received.
Increase the number of participants in future classes.
Expand the range of classes offered.
Develop new recipes for classes.
Offer discounts or special offers for participants who attend multiple classes.
Promote the virtual cooking classes through social media and other channels.
Conduct surveys to determine the most popular types of classes among participants.
Organize special events, such as master classes or workshops, for participants.
Provide opportunities for participants to interact with each other during the classes.
Encourage participants to share their experiences and photos from the classes on social media.
Analyze the performance of each teacher and provide feedback to improve their teaching skills.
Ensure that all classes are conducted in a safe and secure environment.
Maintain a high level of customer service by promptly responding to any questions or concerns from participants.
Regularly update the content of classes to keep them relevant and interesting.
Collaborate with local restaurants or food vendors to offer exclusive discounts or promotions to participants.
Develop a loyalty program for regular participants.
Offer a variety of payment options for participants, including online payments and cash on delivery.
Implement a system to track attendance and participation rates for each class.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations.
Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of virtual classes and make necessary improvements.
